channel.title: Saving Settings in a Flash Drive on Ubuntu?
channel.description:
I'm moving into a small condo that we're renting from one of my dad's friends for a few months and I want to boot Linux off my flashdrive so that I don't need to worry about his computer getting messed up
My question is this: How do I save my settings onto the flash drive that I'm booting off of to save all of my documents and programs?

item.title: Saving Settings in a Flash Drive on Ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Or you could get the archlinux liveusb

Read full topic
item.source: Saving Settings in a Flash Drive on Ubuntu?

item.title: Saving Settings in a Flash Drive on Ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @jimmy5410 jimmy5410
item.description:
@jimmy5410 wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:3, topic:271321”]LiveCD is there for a reason, use it.

Boot LiveCD + save to your usb.[/quote]

Yeah… I had to re-install as I used some App to install Ubuntu to my flashdrive, but now it works.

Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Saving Settings in a Flash Drive on Ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

The flash drive is read/write so it wouldn’t matter. Also, this is stupid as the drivers for his machine will differ from yours (possibly dramatically).

Read full topic
